text: Does any one have IMPOT, working with HubSpot's import api for file size bigger than 2MB? Works fine for size of 800K but fails with 2MB plus size.

Hi.... I need to connect a CTA POP UP or POP UP FORM to my landing page call to action button but it is not working when I use the embed code provided in the javascript option inside the button. Please can someone help?

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Hi everyone!

What’s the best channel to post questions regarding embedding a meeting form? I’m having issues with styling/how the form shows & behaves on an iframe…

When modifying records via HubSpot batch API's, is there any notion of a database savepoint, so if a part of the process fails, the whole process gets rolled back? So no data gets updated? I'm working on ops hub.
If the API fails, then the update fails.
I mean, if I am making mulitple calls
Like I'm removing associations and then creating new ones
removing the associations might be successful, but then creating new ones might fail.
I'd like the whole thing to be rolled back
I can do it in Salesforce. I was just wondering if it can be done in HubSpot.
That doesn't exist to my knowledge
that's what I figured. I would have to implement some kind of original state mechanism and update everything back to what it was
It's not super important for this thing I am working on. I was just wondering.
Very interesting use case though.  Perhaps someone else in the community knows better.
Obviously it would be fairly complex to implement depending on what other integrations you have with HubSpot that could potentially be working off of data updates.
